metadata.title: CVE-2020-2694 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component: Server: Information Schema). Supported versions that are affected are 8.0.18 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows low privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized read access to a subset of MySQL Server accessible data. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 3.1 (Confidentiality impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-2694` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-client - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-router - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-server - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.note: leosilva> since 5.5 is no longer upstream supported and so far we cannot patch it, marking it as ignored. mdeslaur> 8.0.x only

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.19-0ubuntu2').
